summary_points: 1. CoStar Group, Inc. added three new independent directors (Christine M. McCarthy, John Berisford, and Rachel C. Glaser) to its board and appointed Louise S. Sams as Chairperson, effective April 6, 2025, while three other board members resigned.
2.  As of Q4 2024, CoStar Group's websites attracted over 134 million average monthly unique visitors.

3.  D. E. Shaw & Co., L.P., D. E. Shaw Oculus Portfolios, L.L.C., and Third Point LLC entered into support agreements with CoStar Group, Inc., agreeing to standstill provisions and voting agreements for a period ending at least 30 days prior to the 2026 annual meeting.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$657,550,457.01 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of April 4th, 2025, under a stock repurchase program authorized for up to US$1 billion.
2. As of April 4th, 2025,  21,450,977 Class A shares and 10,586,069 Class B shares were repurchased.
3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, ongoing as of April 7th, 2025, aims to enhance shareholder value but is subject to market conditions and other factors, with no guaranteed future impact.
1. Rasesh Patel, Executive Vice President of NRG Consumer, retired from NRG Energy, Inc. on May 19, 2025, after notifying the company on April 7, 2025.
2.  NRG Energy anticipates appointing Patel's replacement by the end of the second quarter of 2025.
3. Patel will remain with the company in an advisory capacity to assist with the transition of his responsibilities.
1. Healthpeak Properties, Inc.'s Chief Financial Officer, Peter A. Scott, resigned on April 2, 2025, to become CEO of Healthcare Realty Trust Incorporated.
2.  The company anticipates naming an internal successor within the coming weeks.
3. Mr. Scott's resignation was voluntary and he is not entitled to any severance payment.
